inlineContent.text: SwiftUIKit is divided into the sections found in the Topics section below.
SwiftUIKit can be installed with the Swift Package Manager:
You can also clone the repository and build the library locally.
The online documentation is currently iOS-specific. To generate documentation for other platforms, open the package in Xcode, select a simulator then run
Note that type extensions are not included in this documentation.
SwiftUIKit is available under the MIT license.

abstract.text: SwiftUIKit adds extra functionality to the SwiftUI framework, like extensions to native types, new views, pickers, utilites etc.
This timer can be used to calculate the elapsed time of any
gesture.
This property wrapper automatically persists any new values
to user defaults and sets the initial property value to the
last persisted value or a default value.

SwiftUIKit adds extra functionality to the SwiftUI framework, like extensions to native types, new views, pickers, utilites etc.
This protocol can be implemented by anything that can alert
errors, e.g. a view that performs a throwing async function.
This typealias helps bridging UIKit and AppKit when working
with fonts in a multi-platform context.
This protocol can be implemented any type that can generate
images of various types from a string.
This protocol can be implemented by anything (e.g. a struct,
enum etc.) that can provide a sheet view.
This view can be used to present text values in a list form.
This generic picker lists
items in a SwiftUI
and binds its
to an external value.
This animation can be used to render a list of dots where a
timer increments the number of dots until the specified max
count is reached, at which the view restarts with zero dots.
This protocol can be implemented by any view that can share
a url, using a certain
This protocol can be implemented by
list items.
This protocol can be implemented by classes or structs that
can be used to identify a font.

view as a
full screen cover. You can either present standard views or

This protocol can be implemented by anything (e.g. a struct,
enum etc.) that can provide a full screen cover view.
This view can be used to display trailing subtitle texts in

This toggle can be used to perform specific actions when it
is toggled on and off, instead of affecting the binding.
This view can be used to create a collection view that uses
any kind of layout, e.g. a vertically scrolling list with a
set of horizontally scrolling rows.
This view can be used to present asynchronous data that can
be either in a loading, fetched or failed state.
This class is shared by presentation-specific contexts, and
can be used to setup global state or present many different
views with a single view modifier.
This view can be used as a topmost scroll view header, that
stretches if the scroll view is pulled down.
